Articles.Content:
Hello folks - another beginner who'll be picking your brains, I'm afraid. First thing will be to watch some videos, do some walk-through tutorials, and then come and ask.

Regards

Paul
Hey Paul, welcome to the forum, feel free to ask anything. The Gameplay questions and Tutorials subforum is very useful and I still like to browse it all the time.

2 hours ago, Noobton said:

Hey Paul, welcome to the forum, feel free to ask anything. The Gameplay questions and Tutorials subforum is very useful and I still like to browse it all the time.

Hi Noobton, and thank you very much. I've started the in-game tutorials and am looking through the resources here. No doubt there will be questions soon.

( I'm also in the process of learning Orbiter - my head hurts a little.   )

Welcome!

You'll probably find the in-game tutorials not very helpful, especially the docking one.  When you get to docking, it'll probably be detrimental to play the in-game tutorial for it.  Lots of help for it here (as it's easily the most difficult skill to master.)

Geonovast, thanks for that warning, which I shall keep in mind. I'm at the very start of KSP,  so I'm still in the process of learning the basics.  However, even at this early stage, I can sense how addictive it might become. :)
